io.github.flowersinthesand.wes.websocket

Class CloseReason

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.flowersinthesand.wes.websocket.CloseReason

  • public class CloseReason
extends Object
    Represents a reason for closure consisting of status code and textual message
    See Also:
    RFC 6455, Section 7.4.1 Defined Status Codes

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static CloseReason ABNORMAL
      1006 is a reserved value and MUST NOT be set as a status code in a Close control frame by an endpoint.
      static CloseReason GOING_AWAY
      1001 indicates that an endpoint is "going away", such as a server going down or a browser having navigated away from a page.
      static CloseReason INCOINSITENT
      1007 indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received data within a message that was not consistent with the type of the message (e.g., non-UTF-8 [RFC3629] data within a text message).
      static CloseReason NO_STATUS_CODE
      1005 is a reserved value and MUST NOT be set as a status code in a Close control frame by an endpoint.
      static CloseReason NORMAL
      1000 indicates a normal closure, meaning that the purpose for which the connection was established has been fulfilled.
      static CloseReason POLICY_VIOLATION
      1008 indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that violates its policy.
      static CloseReason PROTOCOL_ERROR
      1002 indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection due to a protocol error.
      static CloseReason REQUIRED_EXTENSION
      1010 indicates that an endpoint (client) is terminating the connection because it has expected the server to negotiate one or more extension, but the server didn't return them in the response message of the WebSocket handshake.
      static CloseReason SERVER_ERROR
      1011 indicates that a server is terminating the connection because it encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.
      static CloseReason TLS_HANDSHAKE_FAILURE
      1015 is a reserved value and MUST NOT be set as a status code in a Close control frame by an endpoint.
      static CloseReason TOO_BIG
      1009 indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that is too big for it to process.
      static CloseReason UNACCEPTABLE
      1003 indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a type of data it cannot accept (e.g., an endpoint that understands only text data MAY send this if it receives a binary message).

      CloseReason(int code)

    • Field Detail

      • NORMAL

        public static final CloseReason NORMAL
        1000 indicates a normal closure, meaning that the purpose for which the connection was established has been fulfilled.

      • GOING_AWAY

        public static final CloseReason GOING_AWAY
        1001 indicates that an endpoint is "going away", such as a server going down or a browser having navigated away from a page.

      • PROTOCOL_ERROR

        public static final CloseReason PROTOCOL_ERROR
        1002 indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection due to a protocol error.

      • UNACCEPTABLE

        public static final CloseReason UNACCEPTABLE
        1003 indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a type of data it cannot accept (e.g., an endpoint that understands only text data MAY send this if it receives a binary message).

      • NO_STATUS_CODE

        public static final CloseReason NO_STATUS_CODE
        1005 is a reserved value and MUST NOT be set as a status code in a Close control frame by an endpoint. It is designated for use in applications expecting a status code to indicate that no status code was actually present.

      • ABNORMAL

        public static final CloseReason ABNORMAL
        1006 is a reserved value and MUST NOT be set as a status code in a Close control frame by an endpoint. It is designated for use in applications expecting a status code to indicate that the connection was closed abnormally, e.g., without sending or receiving a Close control frame.

      • INCOINSITENT

        public static final CloseReason INCOINSITENT
        1007 indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received data within a message that was not consistent with the type of the message (e.g., non-UTF-8 [RFC3629] data within a text message).

      • POLICY_VIOLATION

        public static final CloseReason POLICY_VIOLATION
        1008 indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that violates its policy. This is a generic status code that can be returned when there is no other more suitable status code (e.g., 1003 or 1009) or if there is a need to hide specific details about the policy.

      • TOO_BIG

        public static final CloseReason TOO_BIG
        1009 indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that is too big for it to process.

      • REQUIRED_EXTENSION

        public static final CloseReason REQUIRED_EXTENSION
        1010 indicates that an endpoint (client) is terminating the connection because it has expected the server to negotiate one or more extension, but the server didn't return them in the response message of the WebSocket handshake. The list of extensions that are needed SHOULD appear in the /reason/ part of the Close frame. Note that this status code is not used by the server, because it can fail the WebSocket handshake instead.

      • SERVER_ERROR

        public static final CloseReason SERVER_ERROR
        1011 indicates that a server is terminating the connection because it encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

      • TLS_HANDSHAKE_FAILURE

        public static final CloseReason TLS_HANDSHAKE_FAILURE
        1015 is a reserved value and MUST NOT be set as a status code in a Close control frame by an endpoint. It is designated for use in applications expecting a status code to indicate that the connection was closed due to a failure to perform a TLS handshake (e.g., the server certificate can't be verified).
